summary: This bill amends Title 44 of the United States Code to restrict donations to Presidential Libraries and Centers. It defines key terms like 'donation' and 'Presidential Library or Center,' and places limitations on who can donate and how much. It prohibits donations from lobbyists, foreign nationals, federal contractors, and those seeking pardons, among others. The bill also includes aggregate donation limits, reporting requirements, and enforcement mechanisms through the Attorney General, establishing civil and criminal penalties for violations, while also addressing conversion of donation to personal use. It also sets up Inflation indexing for penalties.
